text: Mariusz Leszczyński (born 3 April 1957 in Horyniec) is a Polish Roman Catholic priest, theologian, and auxiliary bishop of the Diocese of Zamość-Lubaczów since 1998. == Early life and education == Mariusz Leszczyński was born on 3 April 1957 in Horyniec, Poland. He graduated theological studies at John Paul II Catholic University of Lublin and was ordained a priest on 28 June 1983. == Ecclesiastical career == Leszczyński was appointed auxiliary bishop of the Diocese of Zamość-Lubaczów and titular bishop of Bassiana on 10 June 1998. He received his episcopal consecration on 4 July 1998 in the Cathedral of the Resurrection and St. Thomas the Apostle in Zamość. The principal consecrator was Archbishop Józef Kowalczyk, with co-consecrators Józef Michalik and Jan Śrutwa. == Coat of Arms and Motto == Bishop Leszczyński's coat of arms features the motto Veni Creator Spiritus (Come, Creator Spirit). == References == Category:1957 births Category:Living people Category:Polish Roman Catholic bishops
